channel.title: Rants on David Childers
channel.description: Recent content in Rants on David Childers

item.title: Semiparametrics Done Wrong
item.description: Colleagues, friends, acquaintances, television personalities, and random people on the street often ask me “What is your deal with simulated method of moments?” So, instead of just making a face like I’ve just drunk spoiled milk when I get to the end of a promising abstract and read the phrase “We estimate the model using the simulated method of moments” like I usually do, I figure it would be worthwhile to lay out some more coherent thoughts, with some simple strawman examples, of why I find most analyses using the simulated method of moments (along with related methods like indirect inference1) to be unreliable tools for learning anything useful about the economy.
